question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Define a function $f(x)$ by \[f(x) = \left\{ \begin{aligned} \sqrt{x} & \quad \text{ if } \sqrt{x} \text{ is an integer}, \\ (f(x-1))^2 - 1 & \quad \text{ otherwise}. \end{aligned}\right.\]Compute $f(8).$
inference:
$f(1) = \sqrt{1} = 1$.
$f(2) = (\sqrt{2} \text{ is not an integer}) \implies f(2) = (f(1))^2 - 1 = 1^2 - 1 = 0$.
$f(3) = (\sqrt{3} \text{ is not an integer}) \implies f(3) = (f(2))^2 - 1 = 0^2 - 1 = -1$.
$f(4) = \sqrt{4} = 2$.
$f(5) = (\sqrt{5} \text{ is not an integer}) \implies f(5) = (f(4))^2 - 1 = 2^2 - 1 = 3$.
$f(6) = (\sqrt{6} \text{ is not an integer}) \implies f(6) = (f(5))^2 - 1 = 3^2 - 1 = 8$.
$f(7) = (\sqrt{7} \text{ is not an integer}) \implies f(7) = (f(6))^2 - 1 = 8^2 - 1 = 63$.
$f(8) = \sqrt{8} \text{ is not an integer} \implies f(8) = (f(7))^2 - 1 = 63^2 - 1 = 3969 - 1 = 3968$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{3968}$
ground_truth: According to the second part of the definition of $f,$ the value of $f(8)$ depends on the value of $f(7),$ which depends on the value of $f(6),$ which depends on the value of $f(5),$ which depends on the value of $f(4),$ and $f(4) = \sqrt{4} = 2$ by the first part of the definition. So, we compute $f(5),$ $f(6),$ $f(7),$ and $f(8),$ in that order: \[\begin{aligned} f(5) &= (f(4))^2 - 1 = 2^2 - 1 = 3, \\ f(6) &= (f(5))^2 - 1 = 3^2 - 1 = 8, \\ f(7) &= (f(6))^2 - 1 = 8^2 - 1 = 63, \\ f(8) &= (f(7))^2 - 1 = 63^2 - 1 = \boxed{3968}. \end{aligned}\]
